clinical_study.brief_title: Pyronaridine-artesunate and Artemether-lumefantrine for the Treatment of Paediatric Malaria
clinical_study.official_title: Pyronaridine-artesunate and Artemether-lumefantrine for the Treatment of Paediatric Uncomplicated Falciparum Malaria in Western Kenya

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the efficacy of pyronaridine-artesunate and artemether-lumefantrine for the treatment of uncomplicated Plasmodium falciparum malaria in Kenyan children.

primary_outcome.measure: PCR-corrected adequate clinical and parasitological response (ACPR)

secondary_outcome.measure: PCR-corrected adequate clinical and parasitological response (ACPR)
crude adequate clinical and parasitological response (ACPR)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 7 days after initial dose
up to 7 days after initial dose

arm_group.description: pyronaridine-artesunate: recommended dose according to body weight, once a day for three days.
artemether-lumefantrine: recommended dose according to body weight, twice a day for three days.

overall_official.affiliation: International Centre of Insect Physiology and Ecology, Mbita, Kenya
